intro: Hieracium obliquans, commonly known as the bent-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring moist to moderately dry conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium obliquans is an annual or biennial plant that produces numerous seeds, contributing to its ability to spread and colonize new areas.
